Message.Msg: I hope so. It seems like IBM is still getting punished for oracle's screw up and that's ridiculous. Oracle is a universally hated company who expanded their hardware sales force. They all missed their quotas and probably sold nothing and now oracle has to fire most of them.

Message.Title: Next month will be critical for IBM
Message.Msg: The stock might fall after hitting a new high as $217 Becareful with a mad cow.
I'd stick with global sentiment, the DJIA, and technicals.

Message.Title: 2012 Annual Report for IBM
Message.Msg: Why is much of the financial data in the annual report only showing 2011 and 2010 data, eg geo revenue pg 50... And ditto on pgs 51, 52, 53...... Can't IBM computers spit out the 2012 data in time for the report? Seems odd to me.

Topic.Title: get out while you can at historic high prices! SHEESH. its just IBM folks

Message.Msg: How many times have we heard this nonsense? Many, since I bought at the split adjusted price of $6 in the mid eighties. Lost half, briefly, in the early nineties, but my heirs will inherit it after I've lived off the dividends for another 30 years. I don't buy companies just to sell them when he markets move up or down. That would incur short/long term capital gains taxes and trading fees; who needs that?

Message.Title: Investors could also consider other technology stocks that are doing well right now. These include NetSol Technologies Inc. (NTWK) and Synopsys Inc. (SNPS) both carrying a Zacks Rank #1 (Strong Buy).

Message.Title: VOLUME
Message.Msg: PATHETIC. Just march quarter window dressing. The public is not in this market.

Nadaq volume one of the lowest of the year. Consumer sentiment weak. Housing sales below concensus. Richmond Manufacting down sharply from Feb. Stocks rally because instiutional money managers are window dressing. Did you see the last 2 moinuttes of trading? That is when the buy programs hit to close stocks strong. The S & P will make a new high this week because the manipulators want it to.

Today marked the lowest volume day on the Nasdaq! This is one day after a distribution day. This is Holy Week, and I did not expect much volume after Passover started. Your data points mean little. Did you forget "Helicopter Ben" is hovering over this market? Don't Fight the Fed!
